etymologies: early 19th century (in an earlier sense). From post-classical Latin rhinarium hairless tip of an animal's nose from ancient Greek ῥιν-, ῥίς nose + post-classical Latin -arium

definitions: In certain insects: a flattened olfactory organ situated on an antenna.

notes.text: Rhinaria of various kinds are present in aphids and psyllids, and in some parasitic hymenopterans.

definitions: A hairless moist area at the tip of the nose in many mammals.
